Type \"admin\" on password input..description: Type "admin" into the password input field.

Expect \"Log In\" to be visible..description: The 'LOG IN' button to submit credentials.

Expect \"Data Protection\" to be visible.description: The text 'Data Protection' is visible on the page.

Select job \"test_365\"..description: Selects the job named 'test_365' from the list of jobs.

Click the \"Run\" button..description: Click the 'Run' button to initiate the job.

Wait until the job status is not \"Runni.step: Wait until the job status is not "Running".
Wait until the job status is not \"Runni.description: The status message indicating the job has finished, which is the most recent event in the events table. Waiting for this text to appear signifies that the job is no longer running.

Expect the job status to be \"Completed\.step: Expect the job status to be "Completed".
Expect the job status to be \"Completed\.description: The status of the job, which is expected to be 'Completed'.

Click create a new job..description: Button on the top left to create a new job.

Expect \"Backup for Microsoft 365\" to b.step: Expect "Backup for Microsoft 365" to be visible.
Expect \"Backup for Microsoft 365\" to b.description: A static text element containing the phrase 'Backup job for Microsoft 365' as part of a job started event description.

Select \"Backup for Microsoft 365\" as t.step: Select "Backup for Microsoft 365" as the job type.

Expect \"Sources\" to be visible..description: The text '1. Sources' which indicates the current step in the wizard.

Type \"danh07emptygr\" on the source sea.step: Type "danh07emptygr" on the source search input.

Click the \"Create new job\" button..description: The button on the top left that the page instructs to click to create a new job.

Click on the icon(\"+\") on the right ne.step: Click on the icon("+") on the right near "Jobs".
Click on the icon(\"+\") on the right ne.description: The plus icon next to the 'Jobs' text, likely used to add a new job.

Select the checkbox labeled \"danh07empt.step: Select the checkbox labeled "danh07emptygr" Group Mailboxes.

Expect \"danh07emptygr\" Group Mailboxes.step: Expect "danh07emptygr" Group Mailboxes to be visible in the right panel.
Expect \"danh07emptygr\" Group Mailboxes.description: The 'danh07emptygr' item listed under 'Group Mailboxes' in the table.

Click Next..description: Click the Next button to proceed.

Expect \"Destination\" to be visible..description: The 'Destination' step in the New Backup Job Wizard.

Click the destination repository dropdow.description: Click the text 'Select a target destination' to open the destination repository dropdown.

Expect \"Schedule\" to be visible..description: The text 'Schedule' which is part of '3. Schedule' in a wizard step.

Ensure \"Do not schedule, run on demand\.step: Ensure "Do not schedule, run on demand" is selected.
Ensure \"Do not schedule, run on demand\.description: Click the checkbox to select 'Do not schedule, run on demand'.

Expect \"Options\" to be visible..description: The 'Options' step in the New Backup Job Wizard for Microsoft 365.

Type \"test_365\" on the Job Name field..step: Type "test_365" on the Job Name field.
Type \"test_365\" on the Job Name field..description: Type "test_365" on the Job Name field.

Click the \"Finish & Run\" button..description: Click the "Finish & Run" button to complete and start the job.

Expect \"Run this job?\" to be visible..step: Expect "Run this job?" to be visible.
Expect \"Run this job?\" to be visible..description: The dialog box titled "Run this job?" which is expected to be visible.
